metadata.Description: Services related to the development, maintenance, and operation of energy infrastructure such as power plants, transmission lines, and distribution networks.

level 1.Description: Energy infrastructure services implement building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
Energy infrastructure services provide funding for renewable energy projects to support the transition to sustainable energy sources.
Energy infrastructure services focus on improving energy access for communities without reliable electricity supply.
Energy infrastructure services play a role in energy transition initiatives to shift from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources.
Energy infrastructure services collaborate and partner with government agencies to implement sustainable energy policies and projects.
Energy infrastructure services contribute to climate change mitigation efforts by promoting the use of renewable energy and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Energy infrastructure services monitor energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and optimize energy efficiency.
Energy infrastructure services set targets for energy efficiency improvements to reduce energy waste and promote sustainable energy practices.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: energy markets
level 2.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 2.Subject: energy markets
level 2.Description: Energy markets collaborate with government agencies to develop and implement policies and regulations that promote a sustainable and efficient energy sector.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 3.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: climate change scenario analysis
level 3.Description: Climate change scenario analysis implements sustainable energy projects to mitigate the impacts of climate change.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

subelement_relations.Description: Electricity generation is a crucial sub-element of energy infrastructure services. It involves the production of electricity from various sources such as fossil fuels, renewable energy, or nuclear power.

Electricity transmission is an essential sub-element of energy infrastructure services. It refers to the process of transporting electricity from power plants to distribution networks or end-users through high-voltage power lines.

Electricity distribution is a vital sub-element of energy infrastructure services. It involves the delivery of electricity from transmission networks to consumers, including households, businesses, and industries.

Natural gas distribution is an important sub-element of energy infrastructure services. It refers to the transportation and delivery of natural gas to end-users, including residential, commercial, and industrial sectors.

Water supply and sanitation are integral sub-elements of energy infrastructure services. They involve the provision of clean and safe water for various purposes, including drinking, sanitation, and industrial use.
